Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, a little dated”
Reviews.Author: Patrick B
Reviews.Content: I stay here when on business; good value, clean but dated. Nice pool and hot tub. Wireless connection is unusably slow.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: FormerHoosier
Reviews.Content: We frequently stay at Marriot locations and this one did not disappoint. Conveniently located just north of the freeway on Indiana 31. The rooms have been recently remodeled, staff is friendly and helpful. Very clean rooms and super comfortable beds. On site Bistro is convenient but there are also many nice restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Big City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DizeeDM
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed here on a business trip. I am used to hotels that cater to business travel to typically provide a complimentary light breakfast, coffee, and a paper. I paid over six dollars for toast and coffee. Perhaps this is typical of very big cities, as I usually am in somewhat smaller cities. But the price is the same as a smaller city so I expected the same. The lobby computer was painfully slow and I gave up. The hotel and rooms are clean and comfortable. The staff is capaple and friendly. They need to put TV channel line up cards in the rooms. The elevators could use some updating, had a little trouble with the button for the 4th floor in the back one, gave up and took the stairs after that.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome”
Reviews.Author: Daniluz R
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, I went for one night and I end up staing 2 nights. The staff was friendly, the rooms were very clean and the food was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: marajoe
Reviews.Content: I have been at this hotel many times. I like it because it's close to my meeting location. Nice people, and easy to get to

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: AthensLair
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for Indianapolis Final 4 in 2010. Just minutes from Indianapolis. Carmel, IN is a VERY safe city near many parks, restaurants, and very nice mall (Keystone Crossing.) This Marriott is in a business district. The hotel: very quiet, clean, comfortable, elegant, and kid friendly. Indoor pool / hot tub are fabulous and clean. Pool is heated. The hotel was VERY quiet, and Final 4 weekend was a great test of that. Definitely kid friendly. Completely non-smoking, no pets allowed, which are my first pre-requisites for ANY hotel when traveling with kids. Free internet and has a business center. Also has a rental car company inside!! Wow! Room: stayed in a 1 bedroom King suite, with a door separating the bedroom from the living area. Parents traveling with kids: this room is awesome for kids!!! The kids sleep in their own bedroom and you can talk/watch TV or whatever, without disrupting their sleep, keeping the peace for everyone, including neighbors. I do not know about other parents traveling with kids, but I dislike tiptoeing around worried about waking my kids up. In this room, you just close the door to their room and they feel like they are at home! The living room came with a comfortable pull-out sofa bed. The room had a refrigerator, microwave, new granite counters, and new cherry furniture. There was a nice desk with pull-out table for dining, and a beautiful leather office chair. There were 2 additional cushioned chairs and a full size sofa sleeper. Two televisions were safely anchored to the dressers/cabinets. The bedroom had an updated radio with iPod dock and a lounging couch. Carpet in the entire room was new and clean. There was a nice balcony with sliding glass door to fresh air. The bedroom and living room each had their own thermostat control. Your kids can have the room temperature they way they want it, and people in the living area can have their own temperature preference. Housekeeping: very thorough and detailed. They cater to your every whim. Bathroom: small, basic, with a full bath/shower, VERY clean, nice tile. The vanity area was VERY clean, carpeted, and was beautiful granite. The staff: very friendly, knowledgeable, and courteous. Parking was ample. The manager and other staff are easy to deal with, should you have special requests, and will do everything they can to appease you.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: toomanymiles
Reviews.Content: Free WiFi. In-room coffee. Clean pool and hot tub. Friendly front desk. My only problem were teenagers, as my room was near the pool/hot tub. Don't get a room there if you need to sleep. Complaints to management didn't help; they were loud and noisy well after 11pm. That said, the front desk people were first rate otherwise. There is the problem of the insanely priced breakfast there. Go down the street to 96th, where you can find much better deals at fast food or sit-down bakery cafes or coffee shops.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but needs more work”
Reviews.Author: BarefootTom
Reviews.Content: The staff at this Marriott property are very nice (Matthew at front desk was excellent), but the hotel's rooms and areas need more work. We arrived and were immediately trapped in an elevator. Staff gave us the impression it was not a rare occurence. The room's bathroom had numerous water problems. Faucet leaked and drain would not open and close easily. Finally, the hotel picks up traffic noise from Meridian Street and I-465. It didn't overwhelm me, but wasn't a disaster, etiher.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: PerkyPeg
Reviews.Content: Excellent front-desk help, cleaning services and breakfast. This place was great for extended visits with a full kitchen (microwave, full-size refrigerator, stove, dishwasher) and also a full equipped exercise room. The staff was very friendly and helpful; good variety of full breakfast, too.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: Phillygwm
Reviews.Content: This Courtyard is laid out in a strange manner; the foot of the bed faces the window and the TV is not easily visible from the bed. Additionally, though a non-smoking hotel, my room reeked of smoke. The first desk person I complained to did nothing about it, not even a spray of Lysol, though I was given a free night by another desk agent when checking out. Bed was just OK but not especially luxurious. Bathroom is adequate, though the sink is in a separate area. Location is convenient off the interstate. Average sized TV with a decent selection of channels and a decent, if not great, fitness area. WiFi is good, though there is also wired connections supposedly available (which I couldn't get to work. Might have been me; I didn't call tech support.) In short, there are a number of other properties in the area which I would consider before this one, but this is an OK choice if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: brijcook
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on priceline and was very happy with the stay. The staff was friendly, the room was clean and easily to find. This is a great hotel for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay to see the races”
Reviews.Author: kennyboi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to watch the Formula 1 race in June 2007. I would highly recommend staying here. The rooms are huge and clean. Theres room service with great desserts. We left early during the friday practice sessions because we forgot to buy earplugs with the car's revving at 19,000rpm it wasnt very healthy to stick around, the front desk guys gave us a complimentary pair for no charge, how thoughtful! Also theres a restaurant next door which is a plus because there none around in the area. To get to Indinapolis Motor Speedway, is about $30 each way, on race day this goes up to $40 plus which is normal. Be sure to get a cabs number, youll need it handy coming back from the track to the hotel. Its very hard to get a cab after the race, be sure to have a map handy if you decide to walk. Its also a short 5 min walk from the shopping area downtown so enjoy! Would not stay anywhere else but here when Formula 1 returns at Indy!

Reviews.Title: “Other area hotels are better”
Reviews.Author: klhenry97
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights in early August 2008 on a business trip. I would recommend that you try two of the other hotels prior to booking at this Marriott. I recommend the Doubletree Inn in Carmel, which is within one mile of this Marriott. The other is the Hilton Garden Inn, and is slightly better than this Marriott. POSITIVES: - The front-desk staff was courteous and fulfilled the few minor requests I had. - Clean room on arrival. - The air conditioner, bathroom and lighting fixtures, wireless access, and TV worked well - The black-out curtains worked very well at blocking the light - I was in an end room that was very quiet - Outlets were conveniently located for battery chargers NEGATIVES: - I left water in the plastic bag ice bucket liner when I left in the morning. When I returned later that evening, the ice bucket had been placed back in its spot, but the plastic bag had not been replaced, and still contained the water from the previous night. - The drinking containers provided are glass. I don't trust the cleanliness of glasses in hotels. - The TV was placed right next to the armoire in such a manner that the entire screen cannot be seen while laying in the bed. If you move to the far edge of the bed, you can see most of the screen, but are still unable to see about two inches of the edge of the screen. The TV cannot be moved. The full screen can be seen from the couch. - As you walk down the long hallways, you have no visual cues to let you know you are walking in the correct direction to get to the front desk. You just have to set off in the direction you think is correct, and if you are right you will come to a connecting hallway. The hotel would benefit from a few extra visual cues that are more visible from down the hall. - There are no refrigerators provided in the rooms. I *think* you can rent one at the front desk based on a little sign in the refrigerated section of the hotel's convenience store (where they sell snacks, ice cream, toiletries, etc) This option was not mentioned when I checked in, and like I said, it may not even be an option. - Two of the other area hotels - the Hilton Garden Inn and Doubletree Inn have alarm clocks that have an aux input that allows you to hook up your iPod or MP3 player to allow for music through the clock's speakers, and wake up to your own tunes. No such perq here at the Marriott. - The pillows were all feather and all pretty thin on my king-size bed

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, nothing fancy”
Reviews.Author: kcrampton
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 1 night on a business trip. The location is convenient for the north-side of Indy - on Meridian, just north of 465. It's in an office area, very quiet. I don't think anything is within walking distance, but plenty of things (shopping, dining, etc.) a short drive away. It was clean, the people were nice. The room was pretty standard (1 King bed on my stay). Nothing particularly special, but nothing bad. Shower was good, bed was very comfortable (pillow top style). Towels a bit skimpy, but plenty to go around. Curiously, no exhaust fan in the bath (only a vent). Free internet access is great, including a few internet stations by the front desk if you don't have a laptop. A nice middle courtyard area (for once the hotel name is appropriate). A tiny exercise room, plus a nicer pool & whirlpool. No on-site dining/bar, except a breakfast buffett, which was OK. Overall, I would stay again. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lombradinino
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. We stayed the weekend of September 14-16, 2007, in a room with a king bed overlooking the courtyard. The entire hotel was remodeled over the last couple years (parking lot & pool in 2007, rooms and interiors in 2006 – I think) and it shows. The room was clean and the maid service was prompt, stocked with the usual shampoos, soap, towels, etc. It was a little small for a family, but it was a good size for me and my partner. The television could do with a better variety of channels, but may that always be the worst thing anyone can say about their trip. It was also quiet. We never heard the people in the room next door. The people at the front desk were friendly, informative and helpful. The breakfast buffet was good with a good variety of food (eggs, bacon, sausage, waffles, cereal, muffins, oatmeal, etc.). The hotel is about 20 minutes from the middle of downtown Indianapolis in a business park, so it’s relatively quiet on the weekend with easy access to the city (just a straight shot down Meridian). Overall, we both enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice motel.”
Reviews.Author: bt0wn
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here and got the Children's Museum package. The room was exceptionally clean, and comfortable. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Great location if visiting the Children's Musuem. My only complaints were that I was under the impression that the breakfast buffet was included in my package, when we got to the lobby the next morning it listed an $8.95/adult and $4.95/child charge, which I thought was a little stout. They did clear it up and we were supposed to have received breakfast vouchers when we checked in. The staff was very helpful in getting this taken care of. The other issue was the parking, we came in late and the parking lot was full, we were told to park in the Thompson's parking lot, but felt uneasy about doing that. We waited around for about another half hour and were finally able to find a spot. We would definitely stay here again.
